samples.name: Default Functionalities
samples.description: The example demonstrates the default rendering of the JavaScript(ES5) dialog, which supports modal and non-modal (modeless), built-in buttons, and more.

samples.name: Custom Dialogs
samples.description: This example demonstrates how to create custom dialogs such as alert dialogs, confirmation dialogs, and prompt dialogs using the JavaScript(ES5) dialog control.
This example demonstrates how to customize user interface elements like the header, footer, and content of the JavaScript(ES5) dialog control using a template.
samples.name: Template
Modal
samples.description: This example demonstrates the modal pop-up behavior of the JavaScript(ES5) dialog control, which helps display critical information such as errors and warnings.
The example demonstrates how to load the content of the JavaScript(ES5) dialog control from external sources such as a file or website using Ajax library.
samples.name: Ajax Content
Draggable
samples.description: This example shows how to enable drag-and-drop actions in the JavaScript(ES5) dialog control to help reposition the dialog efficiently.
This example shows how to create resizable modal in the JavaScript(ES5) dialog to change the size of a dialog efficiently and view its content more comfortably.
samples.name: Resizable
Positioning
samples.description: This example demonstrates how to display the JavaScript(ES5) dialog control at various built-in and custom positions.

samples.name: Animation
samples.description: This example demonstrates how to open or close the JavaScript(ES5) dialog with various animation effects, and how to customize the animation duration and delay.

samples.name: Multiple Dialogs
samples.description: This example shows how to display multiple dialogs sequentially and open multiple dialogs simultaneously for both modal and modeless JavaScript(ES5) dialogs.

samples.name: Components inside Dialog
samples.description: This example demonstrates how to render other JavaScript(ES5) Syncfusion components inside the dialog component.
